question: Which country's government guiding philosophy is "Gross National Happiness"?
explanation: Gross National Happiness is the guiding principle of Bhuta's government. It is an index used to measure overall happiness and welfare of people. Gross National Happiness involves sustainable and equitable socio-economic development; environmental conservation; culture preservation and promotion and good governance. In 2008, the Constitution of Bhutan identified Gross National Happiness as the goal of the Bhutan Government. The term was coined by the fourth King of Bhutan Jigme Singye Wangchuk in 1979. According to him, Gross National Happiness is more important than Gross National Product.
